description: a(n) = n-th triangular number (the sum of the first n integers) in base n.
comments: Note that these numbers should be read in base n. For instance, a(19) = 100 is actually (10)(00) in base 19, which equals 190 (the 19th triangular number) in base 10. - _T. D. Noe_, Feb 01 2013
